div.p: The Pendleton School District is committed to helping community and family through the coronavirus pandemic. We have established a dedicated area for you to get the latest information and education material.

avia-slideshow avia-slideshow-1 av-control-default av-default-height-applied avia-slideshow-featured av_slideshow_full avia-fade-slider

div.h3: Welcome to the Pendleton School District
div.p: Welcome to the Pendleton School District. We are located at the base of the Blue Mountains in Northeastern Oregon. Pendleton is known worldwide for the Pendleton Round Up, which takes place the second week of September for more than a 100 years. We are equally proud of our school district that provides diverse opportunities for students in preparation for their lives after high school.

We are home to 3100 students, 165 licensed staff and 150 support staff. We operate four elementary schools, one middle school, one comprehensive high school and one alternative high school. In addition, we are the host to Nixya’awii Charter School that serves students on the Confederate Tribes of the Umatilla Indian Reservation.
Our work is driven by four main goals that are the focus of our efforts and they include:

Instructional Excellence, which involves seeking out the very best people to work with our students. Then providing our staff with professional growth opportunities throughout their careers. Our people make the difference.
Being Responsive to the needs of all students is reflected in our motto, “Every student, every day”.
Innovative and emerging trends and practices is a trademark for our district. We are proud of such innovations as the Pendleton Early Learning Center to our Agricultural Sciences program.
Living the Brand speaks to the value we place on what we do every day and the impact that we have on our students.

div.p:
Come visit us and perhaps join our team or our community as we pursue our vision,
“The Pendleton School District, a place where you belong, a place where you can succeed.”

a.title: District Designated as Best Communities for Music Education
District Designated as Best Communities for Music Education

h3.a: District Designated as Best Communities for Music Education

div.div:
Pendleton School District 16R has been honored with the Best Communities for Music Education designation from The NAMM Foundation for its outstanding commitment to music education.
Read more

span.span: District Designated as Best Communities for Music Education

article.class: slide-entry flex_column post-entry post-entry-1223 slide-entry-overview slide-loop-2 slide-parity-even post-entry-last av_one_half real-thumbnail

div.div:
Today at 1 pm, Governor Kate Brown announced that public schools in Oregon would be closed to students for the remainder of the school year.
Read more

h2.a: Meals During the Closure – New location added

div.p: Beginning Monday, April 13, 2020, Grab-n-Go free meals for children ages 1 – 18, will be available at 4 locations, Monday – Friday.

a.title: Permanent Link: Crystal Apple Awards CANCELLED

div.p: Due to the COVID-19 emergency and subsequent school district closures in Oregon, the 2020 Crystal Apple Awards for all districts in eastern Oregon are CANCELLED.

a.title: Permanent Link: Distance Learning Plan for Pendleton School District

h2.a: Distance Learning Plan for Pendleton School District

span.span: in District Site News, News - District & All Schools

div.p: The Pendleton School District Administrative Team has been hard at work getting ready to implement a distance learning plan for our students that will begin on Monday, April 13, 2020.

span.span: Distance Learning Plan for Pendleton School District

div.p: The Pendleton School District assures that no person shall on the grounds of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability or income as provided by Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and related authorities, be excluded from participation in, be denied the benefits of, or be otherwise subjected to discrimination under any Pendleton School District sponsored program or activity.

Accessibility Statement | Nondiscrimination Policy | Public Complaint Procedure | Safe Oregon
